visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a variable radius pie chart. The chart should display countries compared by population density and total area for the year 2024. The chart should have a title, styled axes and labels, and a series of data points representing different countries. Each data point should include the country name, total area, and population density. Custom colors should be applied to each slice of the pie chart.

title.text: Countries compared by population density and total area, 2024.

tooltip.pointFormat:
● {point.name}
Area (square km): {point.y}
Population density (people per square km): {point.z}

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a variable radius pie chart. This chart type is suitable for visualizing a second dimension in a pie chart, where the radius of each slice can vary based on a secondary data point. In this case, the chart compares countries by their population density and total area. The chart includes a title aligned to the left, and a tooltip that displays detailed information about each country, including its name, total area, and population density. The data series contains seven countries, each with its respective data points. Custom colors are applied to each slice of the pie chart to enhance visual distinction between the countries. The chart is designed to be visually appealing and informative, providing a clear comparison of the countries based on the given metrics.
